page.title: 13The Railway of Endon (3).
page.content: When steam trains were operational, the railway plate layers cut the grass at the sides of the track because of the fire risk from flying sparks.The grass was given to the railway horses. In 1921 there was a cloudburst in the area and the level of water in Stanley Pool rose so much that it overflowed.A bridge was badly damaged and railway lines were ripped up causing a passenger train derailment. In 1970 the booking hall was taken down and on the site,a newsagents now stands.The signalbox was demolished in 1974 and the level crossing over the Endon to Stanley road was converted to a more modern open type crossing controlled by lights and operated by the train crews when required. Now all that remains of the railway era in Endon is a mineral line.
